docs.lead_paragraph: Here's something I've found myself speculating about recently: could the obesity epidemic have a political impact? In particular, could obesity in a pregnant woman influence the eventual political outlook of her child? I came to this question after mulling over a number of facts.
docs.abstract: How the obesity epidemic could influence the next generation's political outlook.
docs.snippet: How the obesity epidemic could influence the next generation's political outlook.

docs.lead_paragraph: KENNY CHESNEY ''Lucky Old Sun'' (BNA Records) Kenny Chesney became a reigning 21st-century country star by making himself the voice of sheer contentment. In his honey-dipped baritone, Mr. Chesney just about always sang about the pleasures of a stable, settled life and about how everything works out for the best, from beachfront getaways (''No Shoes, No Shirt, No Problems'') to an unexpected pregnancy (''There Goes My Life''). His music stayed on the cozy side of arena country, putting a little bit of modern Nashville into his mixture of 1970s soft rock with Jimmy Buffett's Caribbean lilt.

headline.main: The Guitar Tracks of His Salty Tears

docs.lead_paragraph: This week's guest blogger is Bonnie Fuller, the C.E.O. of Bonnie Fuller Media. Most recently, Fuller served as vice president and chief editorial director of American Media (Star, Shape, Men's Fitness, Natural Health and Fit Pregnancy) and was previously editor in chief of US Weekly, Glamour, Cosmopolitan, Marie Claire, YM and Flare magazines. In this her final post, Fuller gives her take on the style world's latest parlor game: analyzing where Madonna and her husband, Guy Ritchie, went wrong. E-mail her at info@bonniefuller.com, follow her on Twitter here and read her previous columns.

headline.main: For the Moment | Bonnie Fuller on the War of the Ritchies
